ai.summary: Carntogher Way is a challenging 19.9 km hike in the UK that traverses varied terrain and exposed moorland. It demands good fitness, navigation, and a cautious approach to changing weather, with several ascent and descent sections that keep you on your toes.
ai.terrain_summary: Expect a mix of rugged footpaths, potentially boggy moorland, rocky sections, and steeper climbs. The route can include uneven ground, exposed ridgelines, and optional stream crossings depending on conditions.
ai.safety_notes: Plan for variable UK weather with rapid changes. Carry a map and compass (and know how to use them), a fully charged phone, and a whistle. Wear sturdy boots and weather-appropriate layers; bring waterproofs, extra clothing, and plenty of water and high-energy snacks. Start early to ensure daylight, tell someone your route, and be prepared for navigation in exposed sections; avoid the hike in heavy fog, high winds, or icy conditions. Watch for boggy areas, loose scree, and steep descents, and respect local wildlife and ticks.
recommended_gear: Map and compass (or GPS device) and knowledge to use them
Fully charged phone and emergency power bank
ai.best_seasons: Spring to autumn for most navigable conditions; winter hiking is possible but requires advanced skills, shorter daylight, and more caution.

seo.meta_description: Explore Carntogher Way, a demanding 19.9 km hike in the UK. Learn about terrain, safety tips, essential gear, and the best seasons for this challenging trek.
